alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; Eastern Chichagof Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 24 at 5:55AM AKST until February 25 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY... .Low pressure over the NE Gulf will remain in place through Friday while an associated front with embedded waves will move over the panhandle. Dry snow has spread as far south as Metlakatla as of 530am. Light snow is expected through the day, then a stronger wave along the front will cause rates to pick up in the late afternoon and evening moves. Some uncertainty remains regarding snow totals due to limited moisture and less inner channels. For most areas the greatest snowfall rates continue to be Friday evening through early Saturday morning while Yakutat bay see snow ending earlier. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Chichagof Island and Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult due to reduced visibility and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light, dry snow will fall through Friday morning. Greatest snowfall rates are expected late Friday afternoon through Friday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; Eastern Chichagof Island
